There is Plenty of Parking in the area, I've noticed some Pan-handlers in the area, but they didn't Bother Me!  Anyhoo, Back to the Review...  =)

FoneStar Repair has 2 Owners, John or J.P & Rann! John Takes Care of the Front End of the Business, While his Partner Rann Handles the Technical Part!

 It is a Little Cozy Shop in a Not So Nice Area, but Don't let that Get in the Way of Coming Here! They do Amazing Work, and I Believe they do Customization Work as Well! They will Fix Your IPhones, Droids, IPads, and More! They Actually fixed My Old Ipod Touch....The First or Second Gen ones. The Home Button wasn't working, and about an Hour Later...Voila, I am a Happy Girl! I couldn't even tell where it was opened, no scratches..Nothing! They do Repair Electronic Equipment as well, But Give them a Call....Just to Make Sure! ;)

These Guys Know Their Stuff, Extremely Knowledgeable, and Customer Service is Superb! They do have a few discounts...

They Are As Follows...
10% off Your First Visit (Yelp Check-in)
They also have a Veteran Discount, as well! That's Plus 10% if you Combine it with the Yelp Check in!

If you are Living Anywhere in the Las Vegas Area, Give Them a Call! You Will Not Be Disappointed with the Finished Product! I am Just One Reviewer Out Of All the Others, But I'd Personally Would Go to FoneStar Repair for My Droid if I had Any Problems with it, They Will Tell You How it is.....No Muss, No Fuss! I'm Happy....And You Will Be Too! 

Much Mahalos John & Rann! You Guys ROCK! =)
Disregard all the negative publicity, this restaurant is a true gem...  Great ambiance,  amazing atmosphere, excellent service and phenomenal food...  A Must!

This bar is located very close from the entrance of the Wynn Theater, so it's perfect if you want  to have a drink before the show "Le Rêve".

The only downside? Only few seats available at the bar, maybe 10, and you can't sit somewhere else, all the seats are at the bar.

Bartender was very polite and friendly, and yes they have Guinness (bottle).

Well, during our Thanksgiving 2017 trip to Toronto, we ended up in this store while out and about. What a great little gem!

The store is everything you would expect from a comics store: shelves and shelves of comics, paraphernalia, t-shirts and other cookie and quirky and dorky things.

Attendants were prompt and courteous, patient. Place is dimly lit, but enough to see what's going on. They have an awesome coffeeshop in there as well --the Black Canary.

We ended up buying a couple of things and left feeling great.

If you're in Toronto and into comics and espresso drinks, this is a place you have to check out.

Had so much fun with my family! Even though we didn't win, we enjoyed each others company and that's what's important in life! 
I love the bingo room!

I'm not sure what all the buzz is about Graze. The service was fine but I found the menu uninspiring.  There were six of us our table. so a variety of dishes were ordered.  

We started with a cheese plate. The selections were decent enough and tasty, but I thought the servings were a bit on the small side. If you are from the greater Madison area, all the cheese selections we ordered were easily found at a decent market or grocery store.

I ordered the Chicken and Waffle. It was said to be something of a signature dish at Graze. The chicken was bland and and  not at all tender. The waffle cold,  essentially flavorless and flat. The waffle was cold enough that the savory butter on the waffle refused to melt at all. The quintessential Chicken and Waffle dish should have a plump, yet crispy savory couple of pieces of chicken atop a crisp thick, slightly sweet waffle. 

A couple of people ordered the Mac & Cheese... a bit pricey for the size of the dish... the serving looked more like a side dish. This said, those that ordered it said it was very rich and satisfying.  Another in our party ordered the Bip Bop. It looked pretty good and yet another ordered the Market Grilled Steak. It looked decent. I think the star and most memorable aspect of the of the night was the Sticky Pudding. This was really good, very rich, and I dare say sticky. 

I just expected more from Graze... if I am going to pay a premium for comfort food, it should wow me... I should be contemplating what I am going to order on my next visit.  I could have ordered a burger... but I'm pretty particular about my burgers... The $12 burger seemed pretty standard for the price tag... The $21 burger looked intriguing, but not $21 intriguing. It may be the Capitol Square, but it's not Michigan Avenue.

Would I go back - I doubt it...

REALLY DISAPPOINTING. 

We ordered fried tofu, vegetarian spring rolls, vegetarian summer rolls and ginger tofu and bok choy on vermicelli.

Everything was mediocre but the vermicelli was overwhelmingly gingery. The best part of the meal was the peanut sauce.

Totally understaffed, really cramped and far too warm in there. Door was open and no A/C as far as I could tell. We won't be back.

Looking for cider? Go no further.

I almost exclusively drink cider, so when I say that this place is great...I really mean it. However, regardless of your thoughts on cider, you need to stop by this place! There's always a variety on tap, which you can try before you settle on one. My personal favorite is either the Fighting Elleck or Bone Dry, depending on my mood for the evening.

Not only do I love the cider, but the great story of this place: starting this location as a way for the owners to spend more time with their kids and working from their own home. That said, this place can be hard to miss if you don't know to look for it. But once you're there, you MUST not only try the cider, but do it in the backyard area where there is typically live music and a food truck to round out the visit.

This place really is a gem and I'm so glad that many other local Pittsburgh businesses regularly keep Arsenal on tap!

I appreciated the decent massage after the three times i asked the masseuse to take it easy after she hurt me! My best friend and i took the 90 minute massage for $55. It was nice until it was ruined when we wanted to tip them. I have never seen a tip chart in my life before. She whipped out a tip chart with happy levels and we felt extremely manipulated. They wanted 27% for a $55 balance? What the hell? I should never feel guilted into tipping. We were already giving them 18% when one of the masseuses said "more for me?"  First and last time we come here. Thanks for the service, but no need to be so greedy.

Tried some cookies and a brownie from here. A very small bakery wtih a seat inside and also outside. More of a place to get sweets on the go. 

The cookies were super flat like a thin crust pizza. There were various flavours available like peanut butter and chocolate. Some flavours were already sold out when we arrived. I think the cookies are $1 each when you buy them individually as appose to getting a dozen. Thats damn expensive for a cookie if you ask me. The cookies tasted great and I would give them 4 stars.

The brownie was lavader flavoured. It was chocolatey and chewy just like a brownie should be. Nothing really stood out on the brownie for me. They also had croissants and I wish I had room to fit that in my stomach aswell but I was just too full already from Mexican food down the road. 

3.5 stars

Best breakfast/brunch spot in Montreal, IMHO ... you must try the Brunch Sucre - its to die for!  Cafe au lait is wonderful, and service is fantastic! It helps to speak French but the servers (most of them) speak English.  Anticipate a wait out the door (1 hr?) on weekend mornings ... its worth it!

Glad I happened to notice this little place. It's tucked in the corner  but I was pleasantly surprised to find it. All sorts of fresh options...subs with fresh cut meats, veggies that were clearly wrapped to keep fresh, homemade sides, treats, drinks, smoothies, fresh brewed flavored teas, and to top it off, a rolled ice cream station in front? It looked very clean and maintained and service was very friendly and welcoming. Decent pricing and close to home, I really liked it I'll definitely be back for more.

I love love this hotel!! Old Sahara Hotel! It's so modern and has a great pool. Also, it is so close to Fremont St. and in Las Vegas Blvd. which is easily accessible to the main drag if flashy Vegas. This is going to be my go to place from now on. I will recommend it.  Plus it quite, when you need a minute. Yeah!
Went to get the battery tested it failed, Steven offered to put in new one so I let him go ahead.  Best free installation in town.  Use these guys again no questions asked.

I'm not a huge fan of Potbelly but my boyfriend LOVES it. The reason why I rate this location so high is because he's vegetarian and they remember his order every time he comes in. The employees are so friendly and do a really great job. The lines are fast. The location is clean.

What can I say about all 'Fat Tuesdays'?! All flavors are good! Always make sure to add that 151 shot for a $1 more....I mean why not, right?!! I usually get the 2nd to the biggest container until I get to the next 'Fat Tuesday' store...

Lots of juices to try and all are premium. Nice vibe. Very sheik layout. Thanks Dillon and all vapeco staff! Great customer service. Got the re-fresh juice by California vaping and an Atlantis occ to use on my sense herakles( we'll see how that pans out) :) overall nice experience. Will stop by if I'm in the area again.

I came here to get my acrylic nails removed and just a quick manicure. This place had great reviews and was reasonably priced, plus in the pictures it didn't look like a chop shop, clearly I was wrong. I got there right at 11am when my appointment was scheduled but was asked if I could wait 10 min as they were running behind and I said that's fine. At 11:15 Nina (I think that was her name) took me back and began removing my acrylics. Now the WORST way to remove acrylics is for them to take another fake nail and pry the acrylic from your natural nail, I know this because I've worked in high end salons for the past 3 years (and the reason I did not go to my salon was because there was no time available when I could go). I saw Nina pull out the box of fake nails and I said "Are you going to soak my nails in acetone first, I have sensitive nails and it hurts when you pry them off." She said she was going to try prying them off anyway and if it hurts she will soak....okay so she started to pry and I said "yes that hurts." Her reply was "I can soak your nails but I doubt I'll have time to do a manicure cuz then I'll run late in my next appointment." Here's where I'm confused. When I booked my appointment they sent me an email to confirm saying "11am acrylic removal and 11:30am manicure" that means the removal should take 30 minutes which is how long it takes if you soak them. To pry off my acrylics and not soak them that would take maybe 10 minutes. So I was already booked for the full time to properly remove them so why would my time run over? She told me if she doesn't have time for my manicure someone else will do it which was fine with me. While my nails are soaking she's walking around the salon, slouching, looking like I'm wasting her time. While she's doing my nails she proceeds to tell me "next time don't get acrylic get gels it's better" I said "no I like acrylic I'm just taking a break before I get them again". When she does my manicure it's so sloppy, she's taking way too much polish and it just looked a mess. And she finished me 15 minutes early so it took her only 45 minutes to rush through my appointment. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because I want to come back and see Kim for my acrylics because everyone speaks so highly of her. But as for any other service, I would not come back and would not recommend this place to anyone else because it is just a chop shop.

THIS GOES FOR ALL CHIPOTLES: this is the grossest food i've ever had! It's not even real Mexican food! Not even close to Americanized Mexican food at least! Bland, tasteless meat, beans, and rice. That's all it is. The only good thing about this place? THE CHIPS!

I live in Kensington Market, and this is the take out place I frequent the most (which is saying something considering how good the take out options are in The Market). 

Every single thing on their menu is amazing. The sandwiches, the salads, it doesn't matter what it is, these guys know what they're doing. Also, I'm not a big soda guy, but I always get a soda from here. They have a robust flavour, unlike the processed/mass produced flavours normal canned pop has. They are also not as sweet, which is nice. My favourite is the ginger ale for sure, because it gives a bit of a bite.

To boot, the two guys who run the place are standup gentlemen, so I feel good about spending my money there.

Jamie Express has been around for a long time. 

This place is cheap and cash only , so keep that in mind, when ordering here. 

The (x) choice dishes for 3 come in under $20 and comes with rice and soup, which is extra value and is cheaper than their competitors. That being said - food quality is  decent for the price point and really can't be beat. They, also, have quite plenty of variety to choose from. 

Service is pleasant and polite and you really can't ask for much more than that at a food stall kiosk in a Chinese mall. 

Overall, not a bad place for a quick no brainer, don't wanna cook dinner with enough leftovers for next day lunch, if required.

Cute little studio with a good price range. They use the nice gel pads under the eyes instead of taping you up. They take their time and really make you sit still so that the lashes turn out great. I went just for holiday lashes but love them so much I wanna go back for a full. I recommend trying these guys out. 

Went back again to have Amber do my lashes and loved her even more than Christy. Thanks again

A little over the top with some food combinations that don't really work together but the atmosphere is A+ and I only tried two dishes.  I would go back, for sure.  Like the efforts at being innovative.

Wait until end. First time I went here it was great. I am vegitarian so I always get a hummus wrap. When I went back it was awful. I don't know if the employee was just being lazy or thought I wouldn't notice but more that half the ingredients where missing from my wrap. A vegi wrap is around $10 after tax so when all that is put in my wrap is rice and shreaded lettuce with some sauce I get pissed off. There are at least 10 ingredients in the vegi wrap. On top of that they don't ask what you'd like as a side at all and their customer service if awful. The wait time is rediculous! If you have a drive thru you should be on top of it, it doesn't even take me 20 minutes to make a wrap or smoothie myself. I only go to tropical smoothie now because my boyfriend likes the chicken wrap, with only 4 ingredients in it I see why. The employees are lazy and don't want to make the complicated orders so they half ass it.

I'm only giving four stars because the gluten free choices were pretty limited. That being said I had my first ever Acai bowl. It was quite tasty and they accommodated my special requests to make a few adjustments to the bowl without any additional charge. It was a nice refreshing treat while being in a stuffy airport. At $7.99 it didn't feel overpriced either.

I can't even try an all you can eat Korean in Austin! Hands down! Hwaro was very authentic and you get your bang for your bucks! All the meats we ordered were so flavorful and great portions! Our waiter was so helpful and very accommodating. Great service, great food and great company! I will be visiting this place when I'm back!

If I had to review this place solely based on the Hibachi experience I'd probably have given it at least three stars.

The Hibachi grill was pretty standard. The food was OK, not great, and the chef did a nice job with the grill entertainment.

Aside from that, this place is awful.

The first thing I noticed was how empty it was at 6:30 p.m. on a Thursday. That should have been my first clue. Then, I couldn't help but  notice how dirty the place was overall. My feet were sticking to the floor as I walked to our table and once I sat down my shoes were almost glued to the floor. 

Our server was pretty bad...and that's being kind. 

My 13-year old son ordered a California roll for dinner. My 10, soon to be 11-year old daughter ordered the Pokemon (chicken/shrimp Hibachi). My wife had the pineapple chicken hibachi and I had a chicken stir fry hibachi.

Again, the Hibachi was fine. The egg rolls we ordered could have been frozen and microwaved and the soup was pretty gross.

I had planned to be very stingy on my tip due to our server's lack of attention to our table. With no other tables--I'm not exaggerating, we were the only group in the hibachi side of the restaurant--our server should have checked on us, at least to refill our drinks.

I was shocked when I received the bill to see 18-percent gratuity already added, which pushed our dinner total for four (two adults and two kids) to $91.50. 

Seriously? 18-percent gratuity? No wonder our server seemed careless. He was. He already was getting 18-percent, why work harder?

Our purpose for visiting the Hibachi was to celebrate my daughter's birthday. It was her choice. She wanted the sparkler cake dessert. Unfortunately, this Hibachi didn't have it. They did have a cheesecake my kids were excited about, but apparently the restaurant was out. They settled for sherbert, which might have been in the freezer since the day the place opened. At least they ate the whipped cream.

We won't be back and I don't recommend this place to anyone else.

The absolute best repair shop I have ever dealt with. I will never go anywhere else. The service manager is very friendly and informative and explained to me everything that needed to be done to my car. I will never go anywhere else.
The sales associates in the store were so kind, friendly, and helpful! Plus everything in the store is adorable.  I will definitely be coming here more frequently!

If you're looking for a cheap fast spot for lunch this is a great stop for you... I have ordered the following.
No. 7
Roast Beef & Provolone Cheese
No. 13
Peppered Pastrami, Turkey & Swiss Cheese
No. 3
Salami, Turkey & Provolone Cheese
No. 1
Ham, Salami, Capicolla, Pepperoni & Provolone Cheese
All of them were pretty good I will be back sometime when I want a cheap sub.

Dozo is one of the best Sushi restaurants in AZ. I'm very picky when it comes to fish quality.  This place does not disappoint.  Their yellowtail and salmon is unbelievable.  For something even more unique, try the Escolar Sashimi.  It is a torch seared buttery flavored type of tuna that is served with a great jalapeno soy dressing with some mixed greens on the side.  This is a very unique dish if you like rich flavored sashimi.  

Robert is the owner and the main sushi chef.  You can tell he takes great pride in his work and you can always watch him prepare the sushi dishes at the sushi bar.  If you are not familiar with their specials just ask and they will be glad to make a suggestion for you.  The staff is always friendly and does their best to make sure your experience is enjoyable.  I have brought many clients here on business dinners and all have been impressed.  Even friends from Japan are surprised with the quality of their fish - especially for AZ!!!  They also have great cooked items for the not so adventurous.  I suggest trying the grilled lamb chop, baked scallop or mussels, and the Hamachi Kama for cooked items.

For those with a sweet tooth, their green tea tiramasu is to die for.  It is made by Robert's wife in-house so is is not always available.  Just ask and if they have it, it is a must try.

I would love to give more stars based just on the shakes and other products offered. 

I  am however unhappy with the level of customer service this place has occasionally. Never felt the need to put in a review until today. 

I am a manager at a business in the area. Myself and my staff members frequent this location for conviene. We are literally there almost every day and get multiple shakes per visit.

Today one of my employees made a "shake run" and was treated with the worst service we have had in a very long time. Most of the young men working there are nice and say good morning/afternoon no question. Today however was another story. 

A caucasian guy was rude and silent as she greeted him. Thankfully there was a second Hispanic guy that was very friendly to help her. 

What bothered me most is the 1st guy commented that we be charged full price. Not once to the best of my knowledge have we asked for a discount. They already have a free shake program after a certain amount of shakes purchased. No big deal. But he thought she didn't hear him while the blender was going. 

Customer service is what people go into a business for in addition to the product. I understand there is a new location on Alma School and Elliot, perhaps we try that location instead.
Been there a couple times,  the burgers are wonderful and priced well.   The staff are very friendly and willing to help with good suggestions. I look forward for my next visit.

AWESOME! AWESOME!  AWESOME!

The shrimp cocktail is absolutely phenomenal.  It's only $1.99 ($.99 with a player's card) and it's totally worth $99.  The shrimp is fresh and tasty and the sauce is tangy and has a kick to it that only horseradish and wasabi gives.  Complement that with some salty crackers, lemon juice, and you have the best snack in Vegas!  It'll give you enough fuel to win some money on the tables before you go out and eat the $7.99 prime rib.  Ahh VEGAS!

Awesome location cute clean room on a park with disc golf course walk to breakfast across the park and near downtown Scottsdale HOWEVER...the beds suck if you have a bad back and the a/c is great but hard to regulate...,

Gina was very polite when I walked in. Rudy was my technician, I got festive gel manicure and massage along with pamper me pedicure SERVICE was amazing.
Oh and the massages awesome.

This used to be my go to Starbucks because the staff is extremely friendly , fast and efficient which is perfect for me since I can just grab and go as I have school. I never had any problems or issues with my orders but recently they keep messing up my iced coffee when I order through the app. Today I gave it another try and I have to say that I am extremely upset about it. My iced coffee was not only watered down, it also didn't seem like that they put in any almond milk requested. I tried calling them but they never pick up the phone. This is the 4th coffee in a row that I have been throwing out without drinking and it's just a waste of my money at this point. I doubt I'll come back to this Starbucks.

Dr. Stephanie Brown is the best, and so is the staff at Glendale Animal Hospital.  I am planning to relocate to Australia, and my two cats and one dog need import permits.  Dr. Brown took the time to research what the Australian government required, and organized everything for them.  In addition to all of this, she has been amazing in providing medical care for my pets, and she referred me to a wonderful dog trainer.  We will miss the excellent service when we move to Australia.

If your looking for Americanized Mexican food, go elsewhere. For real Mexican food that is very good and priced right, this is your place. No frills, no gaudy decorations, no Mariachi band, just very good mexican food.

wow...again. Packed at 10:30 at night especially for a place not on the strip . I'm glad they just built in another section to this place but I have yet to see them make use of it. I love the crampness of this place and the standing bar is actually swaggerific because I felt like I was transported to a trendy dining spot in San Francisco/New York. 
Very nice way to polish two bottles of saki before the feast of kings commence. This time I came back for the exotics :
-Tendon
-Cheeks
-shrimp heads
-Foe Grai or as I like to call it "Heaven on a stick"

A very trendy vegan restaurant has opened in Yorkville about one year ago. Service is polite, friendly and knowledgeable, the food is very savoury (I had the crab cakes and the cauliflower tots, followed by sorbet and a cocktail with pumpkin) for a grand total of $60. I would come back based on my experience.
Awesome margaritas!  The food are a little pricey but very good and we like the fast service.  Live music during dinner is great and enjoyable.
Outstanding, Las Vegas surely gives Detroit a run for their money !!!  I've been a fan for years, the consistency, staff and food quality are excellent.

This place never disappoints. Service is great. Food is amazing and always something new to look at on the walls. My husband is from Chicago and this place is as close to home that he has found out here.

Studio 21 Tattoo Gallery is exactly what you should be looking for when you want to get ink work done.  Clean, professional, honest ARTISTS work here.  They take the time to go over your design ideas and give their own honest opinions as to how they think the design would best suit you as far as colouring, size, etc. so that you get the best tattoo for best longevity.  

I found Studio 21 online and read a couple Yelp reviews--thanks, guys!--and contacted them via email to see if my friend and I could get appointments in that same day.  I was contacted back within 30 minutes of the shop's opening and was able to make an appointment for both my friend and myself.  Walk-ins are also welcome, but I would suggest making an appointment.  There is an $80 minimum on all tattoos, which is standard at most shops.  My piece is about 4"x3" and was very reasonably priced.

I was tattooed by Captain Dave, who had a no-nonsense approach to his work.  As he began working on my piece, he got more friendly and put me at ease.  I could not be more pleased with my piece, which is very detailed--a black and grey shade elephant on my shoulder.  Dave surprised me by being expedient while maintaining highly intricate design details like the wrinkles and hairs--even on the elephant's trunk and tail.

Very, very impressed with the cleanliness, professionalism and quality of the ink work at Studio 21 Tattoo.  If you're from Vegas or just visiting, I highly recommend this place for your tattoo needs!

Yikes. This place was okay... I honestly thought it was going to be MUCH bigger. All in all, there were probably about 6 exhibits and some of their interactive stuff were broken. They have 3 other exhibits that you have to pay for and they nickel and dime you for everything. I paid $36 for two people and it was totally not worth it. I'm from California and I honestly thought since Phoenix was a big city, their museum would be just as big. It was totally rinky dink and I warn you not to waste your time. I would only come back here with kids so they can run around and play with the other kids. Other than that, don't expect to be wow'ed or really learn and benefit from this place. A total ripoff...

Many locals know Flipside for the their restaurants in Fort Mill and Rock Hill, SC which come with some rave reviews. This is their first venture across the state line in NC. The restaurant in located in downtown Pineville near the railroad tracks.

This is a different concept than their other two restaurants. This is of the fast casual variety. You order at the counter of a list of grinders (pressed sandwiches), salads and sides and daily specials. You get a number, grab your drink and find a table and wait for your order.

I had the meatball grinder an a side caesar salad. The meatballs in the grinder were very savory and the sauce was great as well. I was eating that with my fork. The bread was good but I didn't think this idea worked well as a pressed sandwich. By the time my sandwich arrived the bread was mostly broken already so the meatballs didn't stay in the sandwich. The salad was good though.

My coworker had one of their weekly specials, a pulled pork sandwich topped with mac n cheese that he thought was great but not as good as items we've had at their Fort Mill location.

However, this is a new concept for Flipside. The people were friendly and helpful in explaining this concept. And downtown Pineville needs a casual restaurant like this. I will be back and I sure hope this does well here. It certainly got busy after we arrived.

Went in today to see Dr Biggs after being in severe pain for two days. First I need to mention I have anxiety and going to the dentist causes me major discomforts. I've been there once specifically to meet him in person and he was really cool and relaxed. His staff is just WONDERFUL! Everybody seems to be so calm and comforting. His office is super clean and organized and it doesn't looks terrifying like dentists office usually do. 

So today I had to overcome my fear and anxiety and give him a shot. I read a few reviews that mentioned "pain free root canal" and I thought that could not be possible. IT IS!
The only part that wasn't the greatest was numbing but he managed to make me laugh with his stories and his assistant was a really funny lady as well, reassuring me I'd be ok and always checking on me.
I kid you not, I felt absolutely nothing! Reviews don't lie!! This guy is a miracle and I wish everybody that has to go through a root canal treatment would give him a try. It is PAINLESS. Not even a little discomfort, nothing!
I had some root canals before and that's why I was so nervous but I was wrong... it was a pleasant experience and I was able to laugh instead of panic! He was also really attentive explaining me what he was doing when I would ask about a certain noise or instrument. Explained to me to whole post care and what I should do next.
I highly recommend him to EVERYONE!

Great service in a quick-bite-to-eat, make-your-own-sandwich spot. Most of the business probably wanders from those office buildings. People looked lost and in their own heads as they would methodically make their way. It is a sunny day at 74° but it's clear that's it's Friday at the office.
Anyway back to the food-
Choices for breads cheese meats veggies
Chips and soda 
Pretty standard with more selections available too

Sandwich was well prepared and tasted as expected.

Note: Almost gave them four stars because the cashier is a Colts fan but we all make choices and their good service and food shouldn't suffer from his choice to root for the Colts. I joke, I joke. Also, Go Patriots. :)

Usually my trips to VS are pretty lame. I go for their annual sales and grab and go not really looking at anything else. This trip was different because I went specifically to find a push-up bra for a shirt I plan on wearing to an event.

I had my heart set on their "Very Sexy" Push-Up and immediately went to take a look at them. A nice young lady came over and told me about their promotion that day - buy any bra and you get a panty free! Hurray for me, since I was definitely planning on purchasing a bra. Next she asked me if I had been measured, and since I haven't been in awhile she went ahead measured me. Afterward I got the correct bra and headed to the fittings rooms. 

The girl in the fitting room was very helpful and also gave me their "bra box" with a few other push-up bras in my size, but in different styles. I had a few questions about some of the bras and the girl was very helpful in telling me her experience with the certain bras I was trying on. I had also brought the shirt I wanted to wear the bra with and they let me try it on with the merchandise.

Afterwards I went to pay and they did try to push a credit card on me (VS always does this) and I declined. Luckily she wasn't pushy about it and  even gave me a complimentary sample size bottle of their new perfume.

This was a fantastic experience and one I would recommended to any woman who is purchasing new undies/brassieres.
What a great dive!!  Got the combo to try a few things.   Delicious!!!   Just go try this place already!!

I forgot to make an appointment at my regular go-to place (Nailsense) and they couldn't fit me in at the last minute. 

I went into crisis-mode and headed straight to Yelp (after a skim through BlogTO).  I searched and searched for a place that was accessible by the TTC and was consistently rated highly.

My stress level went down when I came across Tiffany Nails & Spa.  All of the Yelp reviews were positive and so I decided to make an appointment for a shellac manicure and shellac pedicure.

When I called to make a next-day appointment, they were very accommodating and polite on the phone.

When I went in, all employees were busy working on clients. I took a seat on the couch and waited about 15 minutes past my appointment time, but no worries... I had time and I was having a nice chat with a man whose wife was in progress and he was waiting on a pedicure.  Apparently, another client had requested additional services beyond what she booked, which was causing the delay.

When a seat was free, Linda called me over to start my pedicure.  She was meticulous, even repairing a bunk toenail for me so it looks brand new!

Ceci did my manicure and was equally as attentive, and totally fixed my ratty fingernails.  Her painting was perfect... edge to edge with no smudging and did a very good job painting under my nails slightly to ensure the polish would last.

The place is clean and quiet and the employees are focused on their clients.  There's occasional conversation among staff, but it's definitely not a loud place.

For shellac colours, this place has the best selection. I'm guessing they had at least 130 colours which beats the 30 or so from which I can to choose at Nailsense.

The steady stream of clients coming through the door is a testament to how good tis place is. There is also a loyalty card: 5 visits gets you a free eyebrow wax.

Their prices are very fair and lower than Nailsense.  Although I still love Nailsense, I'm totally willing to travel to Tiffany.

I was so worried about finding a comparable place and so glad I trusted Yelpers!  Well done, ladies!

i decided to go here for my birthday celebration last week.  I was so impressed by the service we received but the food outdid itself. We all ordered Spencer's steaks and all of us devoured it with much enjoyment. My brother is vegan and he was able to pick from quite the assortment of vegan side dishes. Everyone was so impressed and we all are going back again.
The house italian dressing is so good I'm tempted to drink it. I get a salad every time because of it. I drizzle it on my pizza too.... I have a problem...

Went here for lunch, had spicy noodles.

The staff had a good sense of humor and the food was good.

The management does not allow for quality customer service.

I visited this rink with a friend and paid $13 each for a public skating session.  We only had about an hour left, but that's all we were planning for anyway so it was worth it to us.

I'm a size 10.5 regular shoe.  I tried on a sized 10 skate and it was too long.  A 9 was just right for the length, but the width was too narrow.  I planned to just tough it out since there was only 1 hour left, but it was not at all comfortable.

My friend had a small shoe size.  She ended up trying on 5 different sizes between two different style skates, and they were either too large making for an unstable skate, or too narrow, digging into her foot at the sides.  She tried one of the better fits with a loose lacing, but the hard material near the ankles ended up causing an abrasion after just 2 laps.  

The problem seems to be the cheap quality of the ice skates.  I've ice skated in other states before and have not seen these generic, plastic, no brand skates that they are renting at this facility.

The staff at the counter were very nice and exchanged our skates several times with no problems.  There was, however, a sign posted that stated "no refunds" for public skating sessions.  

The kicker was that the staff member said "Yea, we get these complaints all of the time.  Sorry."  It wasn't that staff member's fault, but one would think that management would look into the complaints and make some changes if this was indeed a common complaint.  It seems that their solution was to post a sign stating that there are no refunds instead of addressing the underlying issue of stocking poor quality skates.

My friend and I had a good time, because there was something hilarious about our failed attempt at ice skating in the desert, which was our mistake to begin with.

I would not recommend this rink to anyone, unless your idea of fun is paying $26 just to try on skates, skating 2 laps around the rink, and having you or your friend suffer from a painful ankle abrasion, all in less than 15 minutes.

Fabulous breakfast here on Sunday morning;  blazing fires, open patios, absolutely love the ambiance here in the Arizona sunshine.   Both my husband and I had eggs/bacon dishes- hubby said the hash browns are "to die for", so don't miss these.  Service was friendly and efficient and our breakfast arrived in just minutes.  Coffee was kept full and we were quite happy with our experience.  It's on the Biltmore property, so expect to pay a little more, ~$45 for two.  Worth it.

Great location on the north end of the strip near the Encore resort. I've been to several Indian places in Vegas and thus far, Bombay is the best! They have friendly service, nice decor, a TON of menu variety, and of course delicious and flavorful Indian food. I will definitely be back!

Danielle is my go-to stylist.  Many places have a hard time putting highlights in dark hair that don't end up looking rusty.  So after a lot of mishaps, I only go to Danielle. She knows what she is doing and I'm so grateful I found her.  On two occasions when Danielle wasn't working, I also got good service from Mock and Mock's sister.  Both did a great job on my color. Thank you, ladies!

I just had a fantastic bean and cheese burrito.  The tortilla was so fresh and tasty.  The beans were creamy and well spiced.  There was the perfect amount of cheese.  The meal was fast was well priced and the staff was friendly.  The atmosphere was pleasant and clean.  Great place!!!

A must try!! Decided to try this last minute with my wife, her sister and husband.  We had a BLAST!! Visited some hidden gems in old Las Vegas and the drink prices were outstanding which is hard to find sometimes.  Although there was only 4 in our party we had a great time with the other groups.  Will definitely do this again in the near future, worth every penny!!

Food was alright. Typical sports bar food. Beer selection on tap is a little weak. But what the atmosphere here is great. I think part of that reason was the bartender Megan. Delightful young lady who was friendly, always smiling and knew half the people there. I'll be back for sure to try some more food. Had the chicken and bacon Saturday special. Was ok. I'd order it again.

As DMVs go, this one is pretty decent. I went in today to transfer my registration and driver's license from out of state to AZ. It went smoothly, but did take awhile, about an hour total. Employees were helpful, pleasant , and diligently working. There were many desks for service agents which were empty, so I'm not sure if they were short staffed today, or if they always have so many empty slots. I was there well after lunch, so I don't imagine they were all on break. Still, I accomplished what I needed to, and the experience was fine.

I showed up with a swollen face! My right side was about the size of a golf ball. I called the office and said I think it's an absess, the lady on the phone was incredibly rude, asking if I was a oral professional. I said no I'm just assuming since I've had one before. So I made my appointment, and went in. I have dental insurance, I'm dual covered. The receptionist said she couldn't find anything and in irder to be seen I had to pay 29.99. I didn't feel like arguing so I just paid it. I have poor teeth this I know and I'm very very subconscious about it. The lady who took my X-rays was incredibly insensitive to my embarrassment, she made this clear when she said wow you need a lot of work done. The dentist came in and was kind, he just really pushed for extra services. He was in and out within 5 minutes. I would only go back in a pinch other than that I'll find somewhere else.

Have been in here several times and was mostly pleased by the friendly service.  Unfortunately, the owner waited on me the other day and was challenging and rude.  I won't go into the details, but he insisted on charging me for a simple request that OTHER (including his) UPS stores have met, for FREE.  And it was a goodwill gesture that would have maybe cost him 2 cents and taken all of 2 minutes...seriously.  Other posters are correct in saying he's arrogant and loses future business by his attitude.  I'll go to the UPS store up the road rather than be subjected to his nastiness.

This is my first time here and definitely not my last.  An absolutely beautiful and historic theater with a pretty bad- chandelier, if I do say so.  If you want to experience the best of what this city has to offer, visit the Benedum.

The bf and I came to see Elf the Musical for our anniversary.  I was blown away by the beauty of the Benedum!  The ceilings!  The lighting!  The candied almonds... Ok so I bought those ... I smelled them them minute I walked in.  It's part of Buddy the Elf's food groups, so I'm allowed right?  Ok ok I'm not here to review the show, I'm supposed to review the Benedum.

The Benedum has all of the features a classic theater had to offer - cathedral ceilings with the gold leaf and naked babies, massive chandeliers, huge archways, and the feeling that history took place here.  So come and visit one of the many shows at the Benedum.  

Excuse me while I enjoy my nuts.

This place has such delicious foods. They are fresh, healthy and I wish there was a location in CA. I love their smoothies and the fact that the have other milk options such as almond and rice, is just wonderful. I got the spring rolls today...delish! I eat here every time I'm in town.

This Subway gets very busy at lunch but the line seemed to move pretty quick. I ordered a tuna sub, which was the sub of the day. I have noticed that all of the Subways have cut way back on toppings, when I am to the end of the line it is a pretty sad looking sandwich. I will probably continue to go to Subway because with their coupons I can get lunch for under $8 and it is convenient to me but this is by no means the best sandwich option around.

First off, the low rating isn't because of the food...It was good, it's real Thai not veit, reminded me of my years spent in Thailand for work. I went with a party of 8 so we ordered many dishes and shared them. My favorite was pla rad prik (fish). My low rating is because of their booking system. The night we went it was jam packed, we had reservations for 630 and arrived just before that. They either overbooked, or people we sitting for hours because we didn't get seated until almost 1 hour after. This restaurant is small, not much room to wait so between all the takeout customers and others waiting for tables, it felt like a crowded subway train. When we finally being seated, another group who was just getting their table as well tried to take a couple of our chairs lol. After a couple of words with them, we found out they were waiting around 45 min after their reservation time. Would I go back to dine in? Probably not on a Friday or Saturday evening, but I would do take out. Hopefully they have gotten better with their bookings, if there were more options in the area we would've left.

We normally order online from our local Papa Johns. While out of town with family we decided to order in and I ended up just calling since it is less than a block away from the condo. 

About an hour and 20 minutes after placing the order my Dad was like "where the heck is the pizza?!. So I call in and come to find out that the driver had another delivery before ours and got in an accident on the way, so another driver went to go get our pizza to then bring to us. 

I mean, that is unfortunate, I don't want to harp on an accident. BUT when the pizza did arrive it was both barely warm and was schmooshed into the side of the box. It became a pseudo calzone. It did look like it had been in an accident, which was interesting.

What I would have hoped for is a new pizza to have been maybe walked across the street. We are literally across the street and a few buildings down.
This bar was one of my fav but now sucks they don't serve Coronas or stela. Beers any more

Just left there after getting my gel manicure done by Jasmine. What an awesome experience all the way around from the receptionists to other stylists. Jasmine is an absolute hoot. We laughed pretty much the whole time. Pretty sure I have found my new nail girl!!! Can't beat being offered wine while you get pampered too!!
As advertised.  A dive with pretty tasty tacos. They weren't groundbreaking or divine, however.
About time I found some good NY pizza and calzon. the salads are great to..................

Well, I hate to say it folks, but I am extremely disappointed. I read the reviews on Yelp and got mixed signals, so I thought I'd test my Vegas Luck and be one of the few that leave with their expectations met.
I don't work too far from the salon so I decided to pop in and make an appointment for the end of my day. I showed her a picture of what I wanted and she said she could do it, designs and all. I even asked 2 times if she was able to do it in matte. 

It started off so well. The conversations were consistent, and the pedicure was relaxing given the long day at work I just had. My friend came in with me so it was just a great vibe altogether. My nail lady - for lack of better term - was making effort to converse and had such a sweet energy to her.

Come time for the manicure, the color that I had requested was different.... i was aiming for a matte deep burgundy with a black matte accenting ring finger. The matte polish ran out as she was in the middle of the second coat, but did not bother saying anything until I did! It looked way too clumpy and bubbly. Scratches were visible! I let her know.

She then started speaking in her language to a younger lady, who suggested to do it the old school way. Nail lady resumes but started rolling her eyes at the lady she was just speaking to. Not only did she struggle doing the matte, but she then tells me that she cant do the design i wanted! Mind you, i confirmed with her PRIOR to making the appointment!

Ridiculous. A whopping 94.00 for a pedicure and 2 gel manicures for a half-assed job. Then had the audacity to say "im not going to charge you for matte cuz its your birthday." You mean you're not going to charge me for matte cuz it ran out on me!!!!!

Dont bother wasting your time here. I was in there for 2 and a half hours, too.

Wow! I first heard about this place on a Facebook group for people living in LV, I figured the menu looked super interesting and I had to check it out! So glad that I did!! Pizza was fab, staff were super friendly and talkative and the desert they recommended was to die for!!! Prices are super reasonable. Enjoyed all of it!

This place was tons of fun.  For starters, I love candy.  I came with a group of friends and the only reason I forced myself to leave was to keep myself from buying too much.  Plenty of difficult to find candy and a huge selection of taffy (I tried 4 flavors,  all delicious).  The owners were there too.   They were chill.

Unfortunately, I wasn't a fan of this place. 

I ordered the pad Thai and peanut beef stir fry to go. The flavours were boring and I found the rice and egg noodles made up for at least half of the small box. I wished there was more lime and peanuts in the pad Thai and wanted the peanut stir fry to be more peanut-y and veggie filled. 

I paid just under $20 for both these dishes and regret the money spent. Next time I'll be sure not to stray from my ol' faithful in Newmarket. 

Also, no coconut rice?!

This is my second time coming here with my husband and it was just as good as the first! What brought me back was the fried rice! It's fresh and flavorful! I got the New York steak and it was tender and juicy.The staff is super friendly which is always a plus.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are good. This is definitely a place to come back too!
Great carwash , self serve . The creamy avocado air freshener is my favorite! The areas generally clean and the water pressure took all the marks off of my car .

Couldn't say enough great things about this place. I decided to introduce my 2 year old to see how she would do, they offer a free trial class which was great! The teachers really tried to make us feel as comfortable as possible and took the time to show us what was going on as we were doing the different activities. The parent and tot class is about 45-60 minutes long and is very busy never a dull moment. My daughter absolutely loved the class she was really shy at first but by the time the class was up she didn't want to leave

WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE

My first mistake was not checking the Arizona Registrar of Contractors for this company.  Redline has a CR65 license which is for window glazing.  The license should be CR67 for alarm companies.  Don't make the mistake I did - always check.  You can confirm this on the Arizona Registrar of Contractors web site.

I live rather remotely but Redline said no problem and came out and installed my system.  This included 4 security cameras tied to the system as well as glass break and other sensors.  This equated to SEVERAL THOUSANDS of dollars.  With the first rain storm two cameras went out.  They came back and replaced them.  The rep said they have these systems all over and never have this type of problem with them.  My husband, who is a general contractor, looked at their installation.  It was not even water proofed.  The cameras are on the roof of the house.

Now it is a little over a year and another camera goes out.  Monitronics sends their teck out to determine what the problem was.  I was told the camera was no good.  Welll of course they are now out of warranty.  I contacted Redline and they said the type of cameras I have are no longer being used but he did get a replacement camera from Alarm.com.  Now I need it connected and learned in to the system.  Monitronics first said they would schedule someone but then called back and said they no longer have anyone that services our area.  What about Redline who sold it to me??  They no longer service my area either.  Well just take the money and run I guess is their motto.  Then Monitronics calls and says they have to terminate my system because they can't service me.  Mind you I had to sign a two year contract but I guess that doesn't count.  

My husband had several conversations with the Arizona Registrar of Contractors as well as the rep from Redline.  The Registrar of Contractors confirmed that Redline is operating 'out of scope' with the license they have.  Redline said they would help get us up and running with a new service provider as well as providing  monetary help for the inconvenience.  We found a company that would service us from Wickenburg - who does have the correct license.  Redline never came through with any help after we made arrangements with the company from Wickenburg.  I wouldn't trust them for any type of job.  Lesson learned

Wow, great place!! Went here for brunch. 

We didn't have reservations but they seated us on the patio, which was perfect. It was hot but patio was covered so it worked out. 

Everything we ordered was yummy. Service was wonderful. 

Located in a cute area/neighborhood.

I was in town for a work conference, this place was recommended to my friends. The bar has all types of music & things to do - live country in the bigger section,80's music in another room, karaoke and I heard there was a bull ( I didn't see this). They close at 2am, the bartenders were fast pouring drinks. It was nice!
Full bar, friendly service and delicious mac & cheese. Vegan options are available.  Great for a late night stop!

Located in Planet Hollywood next to the Sex & The City Slot machine game and across from Spice Market. 

I love my coffee.

Awesome small portioned dishes. The most amazing presentation and execution of a Vegas buffet I've been too.

The service is very attentive and their coffee is really good. You walk away satisfied that you don't need to stuff your face, but had a very portioned tasting of great dishes.
Excellent authentic paella for half the price you'll get anywhere else! Cozy atmosphere & nice terrace.

I had our heater stop working on a hot 100 degree evening. Ryan called me back at 7:30 PM on a Sunday evening. He was able to get to my house by 9:00 PM. He diagnosed and replaced the blower motor and capacitor. He had our house cooling down again by 10:15 PM. Great work. Professional. Honest. I found a new company.

We went here Saturday night for the Seafood Buffet and much to our surprise the food was actually decent and quite tasty.  Price was only $14 which was a plus and can't complain cause the food filled our stomachs.  This buffet was actually alot better than some of the more expensive buffets in the major hotels on The Strip.

Just ok. Not great, not terrible. I did get a few compliments when I got my nails done here, but they didn't give me exactly what I wanted. I told the guy eighteen times that I wanted medium pink, and he just kept saying, "ok, light." I guess he decided I was better suited for light pink. Not a big deal. I also had a few spots where the white bled into the pink, which kinda sucks. Not the worse set I've ever had, but I wouldn't recommend them to a friend.
OMG YUM! This is a no brainer. Everyone gets what they want. I call this Diabetic pizza because of the nice thin crust. The sauce is amazing!

Very disappointed!!

I picked this place because of the reviews that I've read here.  I feel compelled to give my 2 cents worth.

We started out with jalapeno hushpuppies along with their remoulade.  The pups were very tasty (good start).

For our main course, we ordered the fried green tomato salad to share, my wife ordered the gumbo with a side of fried okra, and I ordered the fried catfish with double okra on the side.

The lag time between our pups and meal was LONG......outrageously long.  When they finally brought our meal, my wife didn't get her okra.  They explained that it would take a few more minutes.  Keep in mind, my plate had okra so I guess they must have forgot about hers.  It was no less than 10 minutes before they brought hers out.  

When we finally received our meal the bartender apologized for the wait and explained that everything they have is fresh breaded and not frozen which is why it takes longer.  I can understand how fresh breaded takes longer but you should find a way to do it faster or take it off the menu if it's going to logjam your kitchen.

All this being said, even after the wait, if the food was good I would be writing a positive review right now.  The problem is, the food was just so so.  The okra had NO flavor and was not fully cooked to a nice crisp crust.  My catfish flavor was ok but the breading was pretty thick.  My wife's gumbo was a little bland....almost like the roux was a little weak. 

I really wanted to like this place.  After our first experience, I won't likely go back.

My dad was very pleased with his Father's Day visit here and we all left a little tipsy and fully satisfied. The beers they have on tap are amazing, probably some of the best beers I've had. The place is huge and the vibe is very laid back and welcoming. I could definitely see myself hanging out here after work with some friends trying out different beers.
I like how you get a beer or mimosa with brunch. I didn't like the mimosa but I'm not really a champagne person so I'm glad I stuck with my beer. I'm always looking for some good brown ales and wow they have a couple nice ones on their menu.
I guess the only note I would make was the Monte Cristo wasn't really a Monte Cristo. It wasn't fried and there was no powdered sugar...kind of odd? It just needs a little tweaking and it'll be great.

I really love this Babo tea shop, is very close by UNLV, that is really convenient for me to get one between classes if I starving a babo tea( which I always starving to hv one haha) i love the interior n decorations esp. the wall is very cute... For those havt tried it out, I recommend you to go, and also Hong Kong style egg waffles is a must to try~

Happy to do business with this awesome couple (Andy and Crystal). Setting up the appointment was easy with a phone call which Andy answered right away. They came to install a privacy tint for our sliding glass door. They came on time and dressed with their matching work shirt and even took off their shoes before entering our house. They are both very professional and courteous and did an amazing job for almost half the price. We called a different company before this and the quote was ridiculous. The Mensch's on the otherhand charge a reasonable rate. So don't think twice and call them if you need window tinting.
I like the salads, sandwiches and soups here. I really like that you can mix and match. Nice sized portions. I would like to see a bit more variety for the salad mix-ins. Great desserts too.

Update 1/2016 - TV sound is HORRIBLE. No speakers anywhere near the bar.  What speakers they do have are hidden in the high ceiling amongst ductwork). Really too bad and wrecks the experience because you can't hear/understand anything.  Need some sound baffling as well - all hard surfaces makes normal conversation hard because it's so loud. 

Otherwise, decent space. Beers good depending on when you go (Right now they don't have any standard IPAs just imperial, would be nice I have an IPA).  

Awesome bathrooms. Good TVs but TV layout doesn't make sense in either bar or dining rooms.

Problem: food prices. $12.25 for a quinoa salad with no meat.

Happy hour is now 10am-7pm Sat/Sun which is nice.

Food is hit and miss. I feel they're being a bit cheeky with many items having weird ingredients (Brussels with peanuts and honey mustard? Broccoli with corn nuts? Sweet potato wedges with pomegranate seeds?)
I waited 3 hrs for a recall that 2 service guys said was a 30 min fix. No explanation why, just a bunch of no eye contact. Then they brought the wrong one up to me.

We really like this place for quick build your own pizza and fresh ingredients. Also love the lemonade and tea selections. Don't love that they under fill the carafe of wine. The fill bar is clearly labeled on the carafe.
Great bar. Great drink specials. All the people who come here are so nice and I always feel welcomed! If youre looking for a good drink and a good time come to this place.

I have been to numerous Hooters over the years. Been happy with the consistency of food in both Canada and U.S. Not so in South Charlotte North Carolina near Pineville NC. Ordered boneless wings with a dry rub. Previous orders in Canada and U.S. were a really good size, kinda like chicken fingers. Ordered here, I received 10 tiny nuggets, each smaller than a quarter. Disappointing. Oh but hey to be fair, they did give me 2 slices of celery; each about the size of an apple stem.

Food was delicious. Had the Philly cheese steak it was very flavorful! So was my cappuccino! But I became extremely irritated by the lack of staff's concern or willingness to remove a person from the only available table that was being occupied by non paying customer! The place was packed and 3 other customers came in after we ordered and there was no where for any of us to sit! With a limited seating there needs to be a monitoring system in order for paying customers to fully enjoy their experience! If your whole party has not arrived then you should not be allowed to hold a table!

I'm in town on vacation and decided to take care of some teeth cleaning while I had down time. The flexible  staff was able to fit me into their schedule. Everyone I interacted with was both friendly and professional. I may just visit this location on my next Vegas visit.

This is my favorite airport.  Perhaps I am biased and maybe my familiarity lends to the fact that I think it is easily navigated.  Each area is clearly marked with clear directions to each area.  The fact that it has free wifi is also a major reason I like it so much.

Really cool throw back place. I love sitting at the bar and drinking and eating.
Fabulous mac and cheese, beef stroganoff, onion rings and breakfast is awesome.

 Really everything is delightful.
a must try if you are visiting and if you live here, go and check it out.
The Valley Ho is a trade mark for Scottsdale.
We love you guys !

This company is full of liars. Beginning with their employees who are not trained properly ending with corporate. 
I purchased my pup a year ago. I came into this store looking for a specific type of Pomeranian. I showed a picture of what I was looking for gave a $250 deposit and waited patiently for them to find what I was looking for. 
When I receive that call I'm obviously excited to see the pup. I see her and I fall in love instantly so I buy her. I asked the owner of the franchise if there were pictures of the parents and he said "oh don't worry about that they look just like the picture you showed me." I trusted him. I trusted PetLand $3000 and a year later, I still love her with all my heart but she was NOT what I asked for In the beginning of the process.
This company lies to you. They say they sell pets to you which I'm sure they do. All these animals are pet worthy. But why ask what I'm looking for exactly if they cannot guarantee that?! Why charge a customer $3000 for a "pet" that they cannot guarantee is going to be exact or at least  similar to what you asked for. 
I made a claim because I felt like I was completely ripped off by this company. 
The people from corporate were nice in the beginning, then as I kept calling to follow up they got more and more rude.

I dunno I'm so upset that I was ripped off. I will never buy from this pet store again.

From the moment you walk in the door the staff makes you feel comfortable and at home.  They have several sales professionals that will answer any questions you have.  They have an amazing selection of granite, especially since they doubled the size of there warehouse in the past year.  If you wanna be treated with the best service, and put at ease while making such big decisions for improving your home.....definitely visit Aracruz!!!

What a waste of time!  Horrendous line on Saturday evening 2/15/2014, a few minutes over an hour standing outside then in a crowded lobby.  One order taker, and that's all there could be because there is only one window to order...another window where you pick up your food.  So, a long wait would possibly worth it if, and I mean IF, the food was good.  The Farm Burger was absolutely nothing to write home about.  5 Guys, Habit Burger and In and Out Burgers are dramatically better than Joe's Farm Burger.  The lamb burger was so rich, it caused my wife stomach distress for two days after.  The full rack of ribs was dry and the sauce was non-exceptional.  Garlic fries were garlicky, too much so and the onion rings were just onion rings, nothing new or better.  Sitting outside in the evening was chilly--they do not offer heat lamps.  Prices are on the high side, especially considering the quality of the food.  I have no idea at all why people wait in line for an hour or more to eat this food.  Just because Guy Fieri visited the place does not a great dining experience make.  Joe's Farm Grill is a phenomenon way past it's time.  Even if you live in Gilbert near the restaurant, you would be better served to find another hamburger or rib shack.
Fast service, pretty tasty food, and a nice atmosphere for a restaurant situated inside a mall with no windows.

Excellent atmosphere if you're looking for a place to have some drinks and chat. My fiance and I were seated after an hour wait, once we were seated we were not greeted or approached by a server for roughly 15 minutes. After patiently waiting understanding that it's Saturday night and it was busy I eventually let the host know we were still waiting to order. The manager approached us promptly, he was very professional, apologized and offered drinks on the house. Although it was not necessary at all - it was a very nice gesture. Excellent but limited wine list, local beers from Toronto were a nice touch. We had the smoked salmon board, in my opinion - toast was too thick to pair with fresh smoked salmon. The salmon itself was nice - it was served with capers, onions and fresh parsley. Would have enjoyed it more if it was served with thin sliced baked baguette. Overall the experience was great, menu needs a little work. Perhaps options like, foie gras, oysters, caprese salads, fig salads, and to finish a fruit plate would have been appreciated and suited the atmosphere more. Definitely will be back, but only for the atmosphere and the beautiful decor. The manager's customer service skills were recognized and appreciated.

After my disappointing lunch today (NOT at Sunrise - somewhere else), I begged Spouse to drive me to Sunrise Caribbean in the Sheridan Mall.  Had not been there for almost 3 years, if not more.  THEY HAVE KEPT THEIR STANDARDS AND THE FOOD is STILL AS DELISH AS EVER.  Had the daal puri roti with goat curry - one is HUGE and enough for two people.  Also ordered small goat curry with peas and rice (with added hot sauce), and two triangular shaped pineapple sweet pastries.  The daal puri roti was smooth like silk and very tasty.  Total:  less than $20!!! The food had massive amounts of FLAVOUR.  Mmmm, still lingering on my tongue.  Service is friendly and polite.  I will definitely be back.

This is the real deal for donuts and pastries. Made fresh daily and served warm early in the morning. If you get a craving for a donut at night you'll be able to satisfy it with Rainbow Donuts because they stay open until 9 PM. 

Their staff is super friendly and always serves you a fresh doughnut and a cup of coffee with a smile.

The franchise chains maybe more well known, but this place proves there is a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow and it's filled with donuts.

My mom and I went for dinner! She and the jack daniels burger and I the jack Daniela chicken Sammy - both of which were really good! Also had the brownie obsession which I'm a long-time fav of! The service was decent but there was blaring music during dinner hour on a Wednesday so that was a little much.

Top notch "fresh Mex" fare.  I'm pretty much a fish taco junkie when I go here, and it's not bad at all, could eat them every day.

Whole family finds something they like here, and there is a nice little beer selection as well.

Never once had a problem with service or my order.  Reasonably priced.

The Original Sunrise Cafe is definitely one of the hottest places to grab some breakfast. It's located inside the same plaza as the Starbucks and Yogurtland and LVAC. On Sunday mornings, parking can be VERY tedious, but if you're lucky enough to find some close to the restaurant, generally you wait around 10 minutes (if you're lucky) on a Sunday morning to get some eggs! However, I can honestly say that I've waited 20 minutes before but they usually surpass the time they give and deliver even earlier.

This place knows how to make a good eggs Benedict. I love my eggs Benny's, and Sunrise Cafe does a great job of satisfying my craving whenever I want one. 

The service is really friendly and you can see how they all walk with a pep in their step! Great to see the staff work hard and it definitely shows.

I really like this hospital and their staff. Dr. Thomas and Dr. Tan are passionate about what they do and my pet has been well taken care of by them. My only complaint is that waits are rather long even if you have an appointment. The other complaint is about one of the vet techs- I don't remember her name but she had dark hair and tattoos on her arm. She didn't seem comfortable handling animals and did a sloppy job of taking my pet's weight and temperature etc. The other vet techs in my experience were more patient and thorough. Maybe she's new or something lol.

I am unsure how to commiserate with everyone else's reviews because when I stopped in at 1130 for the supposedly excellent happy hour I was seated immediately and water was dropped off, my drink order taken and then promptly received! I was with a group of friends and we ordered basically everything off of the happy hour menu. 

Word of caution their wings are SPICYYYYY so for those who do not enjoy a fire in your mouth avoid at all costs. 

HOWEVER, even if you do not like calamari I advise EVERYONE to try theirs. For four dollars you will not be disappointed. It seemed they flash fried it and then tossed it in a sweet Thai sauce that had me eating my friends food off of her plate and making me ignore my own wings! 

I really loved their cheesecake because it was not overly rich and had a thicker Graham cracker crust!

All in all I will definitely be returning and would highly recommend someone else going! 

FOOTNOTE: maybe I went to 1130 when they finally sorted out who was a good server and who wasn't?
Just stopped by for a tour after my wife and I have seen several child care places and it was wonderful and we look forward to taking are child there

I wasn't allowed to get strawberries and cherries on my plain ice cream. 
There is a list of fruits you can add and both were on it. 
She told me I could only pick one topping. Their sign boasts "1000's of combinations". Lol what. 

So I don't really know.

My wife and I came here with another couple Sat night. Arrived around 8pm and although busy, we were seated within a few minutes by super friendly staff. Excellent service throughout the evening by attentive wait staff who actually worked as a team. Food was excellent. Plates are all devised to be shared by 4 people which allowed us to sample quite a bit of the menu. Chopped Salad was a surprise in a good way.  Note: the menu does not do justice in print so be sure to get the long form descriptions from your server (although that just made it harder to choose which is why we pretty much had half the menu). Cosy atmosphere. We'll be back.

Very Disappointed. Took my wife and daughter to a belated Mother's Day dinner because we were traveling last week. I wanted to take them somewhere special for I decided on Compass Grill so we could enjoy the view as we ate. 

We get there and we are seated a 15 feet from the window in an awkward one-sided bench table that made conversation difficult. With the reflections from the room and the distance from the glass I could not appreciate the view that we drove 35 miles to see. I asked the server if we could be moved before the food was even ordered. He responded that he would ask the host. He can back a minute later and said that it was not possible because there were no tables available. 

During the entire dinner, I noticed 2 tables to the right of us that were unoccupied even as we departed. I also noticed a couple that sat up by the window and became uncomfortable with the spinning room and their server moved them to another table without asking anyone.

Never in my life have I felt I had to stiff a server but this is a well-deserved life lesson. I will not be back.
I asked for specifically, ten mild sauces because I get my tacos without meat. Sadly after I stressed this, they did not give me the amount I asked for. Tiss tiss Taco Bell employee.

Came here on Black Friday just before the end of the sale and to my surprise they had everything I wanted in the ad still on the shelf. That's really nice cause nothing irks me more than a store that advertises something and not have it available.  The line was deep! It stretched from the front cash registers all the way back to almost the cash registers in the back by the casino entrance! What would be really cool is if they let in the casino guest early! Fortunately the management was on point today and we only had to wait about 15 minutes to get through a huge line.

I have been here several times however today was different. I found the food to be so-so. Everything was over cooked, not 1 person asked if was wanted anything else or how was our meal. The service was horrible. I won't be back nor will I recommend it anymore
Good food. Good service. Clean. Reasonable price Convenient location of the 101 and TBird.

iPad ordering system is efficient. Fish quality (taste, texture) poor compared to a handful of nearby sushi restaurants. Cooked food quality (taste, texture) also poor. There was a single strand of hair inside my green tea ice cream, but I think that's from their supplier because the strand was deep inside the ice cream.
I've been here twice and had great massages both times. I signed up for the massage club becsuse I like the fact that my man and I can share it. Naomi is great.
Can't believe people like this place.. Mark step up your game.. Canned Corn Beef Hash!!!! Stale croissant!! Processed everything.. Being the freshness back
Hands down the best food I've ever had and I ain't lying I'm a chef myself and the dishes look great and most of all taste great ! These dishes speak for themselves

Went all out for this meal. A5 Kobe beef, just wow. Melt in your mouth heaven. For sides we had Brussels sprouts, asparagus, Mac n cheese and creamed spinach. All very good. 

Dessert can't go wrong with English toffee caramel cake and brown butter ice cream. Overall amazing!!

Gordon steak 2/2! Great Job!

Had an awesome experience. The gentleman from Enterprise met me at Harden Auto Body when I was dropping it off to take it in for repairs due to a recent accident. He was very nice, professional, and answered all of my questions since this was my first ever car rental. Thanks again!

I went to the original Wynn buffet a long time ago when we were here and did not go to Wynn 2.0 and decided to try this out.  Yes I have to admit $43.99 per a person was quite a bit of money and the most I have ever paid for one, but I have to admit they did deliver extremely well.  The salad bar is limited though and has a few select choices.  I tried the water melon fruit everyone was ranting and raving over and it was okay too vinegary however.  I enjoyed the crab legs, crab and the shrimp as well as they restock the selection a lot.  I wished though they gave us more duck on the peking duck rolls and we got a lot of bread unfortunately.  The dessert was awesome as the gelato was awesome.  They had the finger and bite size ones as well.

What a horror show! Going in on a Saturday I expected a wait but 45-50 minute wait after order was just ridiculous. After 50 minutes I cancelled my order at which I time I was informed that they had "forgotten" my order. They offered to make my food then but after 50 minutes I was done. What really pisses me off was was that the shift manager "Angel" couldn't be bothered to offer an apology for his staff forgetting my order, even after taking my card and refunding my money, he simply turned back to his little egg machine. Apparently making eggs is more important than your customers. I won't be back. Please tell Angel to take his head out of his ass, especially when it comes to customers and customer service.

Disappointed in my first purchase from Maurice's. I bought a beautiful flamingo colored tank with a crocheted inset. After wearing just one time, and not having been washed yet, many of the crochet ends came out from where they were sewn in. I'm super crafty but I'm not sure I'll be able to get the very delicate pieces back where they need to be without damaging the shirt. Probably won't be shopping here again. Disappointed in the quality and don't like to have to mend my clothes right after buying. Although, the service was GREAT. Very attentive to the customers needs.

This adorable gas station turned coffee shop is exactly what I was looking for Thanksgiving day. No, I'm not the jerk who wants employees to be away from their loved ones to make me coffee, but a person desperately needing a jolt of caffeine before our Friendsgiving celebration. 

A small walk from my hotel brought me to this little oasis with a great coffee and food selection. Turns out the whole family works from 7-11 every Thanksgiving because the husband, "Needs his fix." Of course I understand and am thankful for his addiction too!

Everyone was very friendly, Christmas music was playing and regulars stopped in for coffee and to pick up pre made Thanksgiving pies. The whole atmosphere made me happy and grateful. 

Oh, and the lavender latte made with house made lavender syrup, awesome!

Stop in, you'll not regret it!

$12.95 for a Fat Elvis that rather small in portion. Could have ordered the steak and eggs. Service was bad on this day. Got my Son's single stack pancake with lemon poppy seed topping wrong. Pancake was brought to us with carrot shavings and what look like nuts. Had to wait for the order while the food brought to us is getting cold. Very disappointed. Two cookies don't make up for bad service.

This is my first review so be gentle! I would like to say I came in here at a very good time! From what I hear, it's a densely crowded place with a bit of a wait, but I didn't wait and had a nice seat with my friends! This took place on a Saturday night as well, mind you.

Service was so-so, but goes well with a small shabby place such as Monta. Shabby, but CLEAN. It reminded me very well of the corner noodles houses they have in Japan. Stepping into Monta reminded me of the times I stayed in Japan during hot summers and cold autumns. 

I ordered the Tonkotsu-Shoyu ramen. Dericious aromatic smell, and served hot. I could say I enjoyed every bite and every piece of pork in this ramen! (Mind you, I am not a pork fan.) I believe Monta deserves a first-timers graced visit, so check em out! :)

We were a little apprehensive about this afternoon magic/comedy show .  We were surprisingly shocked how good it was. Mac was very funny , had great tricks and we were throughly entertained. 
Great for all ages!

I love kneaders- I really do. But DO NOT go through the drive-thru if you are in a hurry. I would say average wait time is 10 minutes. 

My only complaint- other than that keep on keeping on Kneaders!

My first time at Flemings for their Sunday brunch and my experience was an absolute pleasure!!! Not only was the food a hit but the service was out standing! Our waitress Bethany might have been the best server I've ever had. Definitely a must go if you haven't already.

P.s order the chicken and waffles

Is Thai Food better than sex? You are damn right it is. Thats why I havent had sex in 3 years but I have been to Archis almost every week for the past couple years. I always get the papaya salad for a nice  foreplay session before I finish strong with a nice plate of Pad Prik King. Sometimes if I want to spice up my night, I also like to get a Pad Thai with Spicy 10 and extra nuts.
